p: Ethnobotanical and traditional medicines are considered as valuable approaches for discovering new medicines because of antiquity medical usage of them over generations. In the current review, the beneﬁcial properties and applications of Dorema spp. Was investigated in ITM books and modern pharmacological studies. The genus Dorema, especially D. ammoniacum known as “ushaq” has been used in folklore and Islamic traditional medicine as a treatment for a wide range of disorders, such as gastrointestinal, upper respiratory tract and central nervous systems’ problems. Besides, many pharmacological activities including anti-microbial, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, cytotoxicity, anticonvulsant, anti-diabetic and hypolipidemic activities have been reported in modern medicine. These species contain various constituents such as terpenes, coumarins and phenolic compounds. However, more studies, particularly clinical trials, are necessary to ﬁll existing gaps in our knowledge of various aspects of these species.
